# La Postal 
<!-- endhide -->

¬øA qui√©n no le gustan las postales? Este es uno de tus primeros ejercicios (si no es el primero) y es divertido y relativamente f√°cil :)

Vamos a crear una postal con HTML5 y CSS y luego puedes compartirla con tu madre o con tu otra mitad, ¬°ella/√©l se va a sentir orgullosa/o! :)

## üå±  ¬øC√≥mo iniciar este proyecto?

1. Asegura que ya tienes una cuenta en GitHub:  https://github.com
2. Recomendamos que abras este repositorio utilizando un entorno de desarrollo como [Codespaces](https://4geeks.com/es/lesson/tutorial-de-github-codespaces) (recomendado) o [Gitpod](https://4geeks.com/es/lesson/como-utilizar-gitpod). Como √∫ltima opci√≥n puedes clonar el repositorio localmente en tu computador utilizando el comando `git clone`.

Este es el repositorio que debes abrir:

```text
https://github.com/breatheco-de/exercise-postcard
```

**üëâ Sigue las siguientes instrucciones sobre** [c√≥mo empezar un proyecto nuevo](https://4geeks.com/es/lesson/como-comenzar-un-proyecto-de-codificacion). Importante --> √âste repositorio no es un template.

## Instrucciones

Crea el HTML y CSS necesario para replicar [esta imagen de forma precisa](https://raw.githubusercontent.com/breatheco-de/exercise-postcard/main/.learn/assets/preview.png).

![postcard preview](https://github.com/breatheco-de/exercise-postcard/blob/main/.learn/assets/preview.png?raw=true)

> ‚úã Aqu√≠ tienes la url del logo de 4Geeks: [http://assets.breatheco.de/apis/img/icon/4geeks.png](http://assets.breatheco.de/apis/img/icon/4geeks.png)

## Empieza por dibujar tu estrategia

![Postcard Strategy](https://github.com/breatheco-de/exercise-postcard/blob/main/.learn/assets/strategy.gif?raw=true)

## ¬øQu√© hacer si est√°s atascado?

Hay un video sobre este ejercicio, m√≠ralo si est√°s perdido. Pero no copies todo, trata de colocar tu propio c√≥digo.

## Fundamentos
Este ejercicio cubre los siguientes fundamentos:

1. Estructura b√°sica para cada sitio web HTML5.  
2. La etiqueta *Link* para importar Reglas CSS.  
3. Uso de fuentes de google.  
3. Uso de diferentes selectores disponibles en CSS.  
4. Trabajar con contenedores o cajas: border, padding y margins.  
5. Overflow.  
6. Uso de un formulario simple.  

Este y otros ejercicios son usados para [aprender a programar](https://4geeksacademy.com/es/aprender-a-programar/aprender-a-programar-desde-cero) por parte de los alumnos de 4Geeks Academy [Coding Bootcamp](https://4geeksacademy.com/us/coding-bootcamp) realizado por [Alejandro S√°nchez](https://twitter.com/alesanchezr) y muchos otros contribuyentes. Conoce m√°s sobre nuestros [Cursos de Programaci√≥n](https://4geeksacademy.com/es/curso-de-programacion-desde-cero?lang=es) para convertirte en [Full Stack Developer](https://4geeksacademy.com/es/coding-bootcamps/desarrollador-full-stack/?lang=es), o nuestro [Data Science Bootcamp](https://4geeksacademy.com/es/coding-bootcamps/curso-datascience-machine-learning).

      # File name: README.md. Content: 
      `<!-- hide -->
# The Postcard
<!-- endhide -->

Who doesn't like postcards? This is one of your first exercises (if not the first), and it's fun and relatively easy :)

Let's create a postcard with HTML5 and CSS3, and then you can share it with your mom or your other half; they will be proud! :)

## üå±  How to start this project?

1. Make sure you have a Github account at:  https://github.com
2. We recommend opening this repository using a provisioning tool like [Codespaces](https://4geeks.com/lesson/what-is-github-codespaces) (recommended) or [Gitpod](https://4geeks.com/lesson/how-to-use-gitpod). Alternatively, you can clone it on your local computer using the `git clone` command. 

This is the repository you need to open or clone:

```text
https://github.com/breatheco-de/exercise-postcard
```

**üëâ Please follow these steps on** [how to start a coding project](https://4geeks.com/lesson/how-to-start-a-project). IMPORTANT --> this repo isn't a template. 


3. The exercises will start and show the instructions automatically, but if you encounter any issues, you can try running them manually by typing in your command line the following:

```bash
$ learnpack start
```

## Instructions

Create the HTML and CSS3 needed to replicate [this exact same picture](https://raw.githubusercontent.com/breatheco-de/exercise-postcard/main/.learn/assets/preview.png).

![postcard preview](https://raw.githubusercontent.com/breatheco-de/exercise-postcard/main/.learn/assets/preview.png)

> ‚úã Here is the url for the 4Geeks logo: [https://github.com/breatheco-de/exercise-postcard/blob/main/.learn/assets/4geeks.png?raw=true](https://github.com/breatheco-de/exercise-postcard/blob/main/.learn/assets/4geeks.png?raw=true)

## Create by drawing your strategy

![Postcard Strategy](https://github.com/breatheco-de/exercise-postcard/raw/main/.learn/assets/strategy.gif?raw=true)

## You can add different fonts by using free [Google Fonts](https://fonts.google.com/)

1. Click on the font you like.

2. Click get font.

3. Click on Embed code.

4. Add the link tags to your html file.


## What to do if you are stuck?

There is a video about this exercise, watch it if you are lost. But don't copy everything, try to code some of your own.

## Fundamentals
This exercise covers the following fundamentals:
1. Basic structure for every HTML5 website.  
2. The *Link* tag to import CSS3 Rules.  
3. Using google fonts.  
3. Using the different selectors available in CSS3.  
4. Working with containers or boxes: border, padding, and margins.  
5. Overflow.  
6. Using a simple form.  

This and many other exercises are built by students as part of the 4Geeks Academy [Coding Bootcamp](https://4geeksacademy.com/us/coding-bootcamp) by [Alejandro S√°nchez](https://twitter.com/alesanchezr) and many other contributors. Find out more about our [Full Stack Developer Course](https://4geeksacademy.com/us/coding-bootcamps/part-time-full-stack-developer), and  [Data Science Bootcamp](https://4geeksacademy.com/us/coding-bootcamps/datascience-machine-learning).


`

3. **Modelo de Caja**: A veces, el problema puede estar relacionado con el modelo de caja (box model) de CSS. ¬øHas revisado los m√°rgenes, bordes y rellenos (padding) de tu bot√≥n y sus contenedores?

ai_interactions.ai_response:
Para poder ayudarte mejor, necesitar√≠a ver el c√≥digo HTML y CSS que est√°s utilizando para tu bot√≥n. Esto nos permitir√° identificar el problema espec√≠fico con la posici√≥n del bot√≥n. Mientras tanto, aqu√≠ hay algunas preguntas y sugerencias que podr√≠an ayudarte a reflexionar sobre el problema: 1. **¬øD√≥nde est√° ubicado el bot√≥n en tu HTML?**: Aseg√∫rate de que el bot√≥n est√© dentro del contenedor correcto. Por ejemplo, si el bot√≥n debe estar dentro de un `div` espec√≠fico, aseg√∫rate de que est√© anidado correctamente. 2. **¬øQu√© propiedades CSS est√°s utilizando para el bot√≥n?**: Revisa las propiedades CSS que est√°s aplicando al bot√≥n. Algunas propiedades clave que podr√≠an afectar la posici√≥n son: - `margin` - `padding` - `position` (y sus valores `relative`, `absolute`, `fixed`, `sticky`) - `top`, `left`, `right`, `bottom` - `display` - `float` 3. **Modelo de Caja (Box Model)**: Aseg√∫rate de que los m√°rgenes, bordes y rellenos (padding) del bot√≥n y sus contenedores est√©n configurados correctamente. 4. **Flexbox o Grid**: Si est√°s utilizando Flexbox o Grid para el dise√±o, aseg√∫rate de que las propiedades est√©n configuradas correctamente para alinear el bot√≥n como deseas. Para avanzar, por favor comparte el c√≥digo HTML y CSS que est√°s utilizando para el bot√≥n. Aqu√≠ tienes un ejemplo de c√≥mo podr√≠as estructurar tu c√≥digo: ### HTML ```html
``` ### CSS ```css .container { /* Estilos para el contenedor */ } .my-button { /* Estilos para el bot√≥n */ margin: 10px; padding: 10px; position: relative; /* o absolute, dependiendo de lo que necesites */ top: 20px; /* Ajusta seg√∫n sea necesario */ left: 50px; /* Ajusta seg√∫n sea necesario */ } ``` ¬øPodr√≠as compartir tu c√≥digo para que podamos revisarlo juntos?

ai_interactions.student_message: .postcard-footer { text-align: center; } button { background-color: rgb(199, 194, 194); padding: 10px; }

      # File name: README.md. Content: 
      `<!-- hide -->
# The Postcard
<!-- endhide -->

Who doesn't like postcards? This is one of your first exercises (if not the first), and it's fun and relatively easy :)

Let's create a postcard with HTML5 and CSS3, and then you can share it with your mom or your other half; they will be proud! :)

## üå±  How to start this project?

1. Make sure you have a Github account at:  https://github.com
2. We recommend opening this repository using a provisioning tool like [Codespaces](https://4geeks.com/lesson/what-is-github-codespaces) (recommended) or [Gitpod](https://4geeks.com/lesson/how-to-use-gitpod). Alternatively, you can clone it on your local computer using the `git clone` command. 

This is the repository you need to open or clone:

```text
https://github.com/breatheco-de/exercise-postcard
```

**üëâ Please follow these steps on** [how to start a coding project](https://4geeks.com/lesson/how-to-start-a-project). IMPORTANT --> this repo isn't a template. 


3. The exercises will start and show the instructions automatically, but if you encounter any issues, you can try running them manually by typing in your command line the following:

```bash
$ learnpack start
```

## Instructions

Create the HTML and CSS3 needed to replicate [this exact same picture](https://raw.githubusercontent.com/breatheco-de/exercise-postcard/main/.learn/assets/preview.png).

![postcard preview](https://raw.githubusercontent.com/breatheco-de/exercise-postcard/main/.learn/assets/preview.png)

> ‚úã Here is the url for the 4Geeks logo: [https://github.com/breatheco-de/exercise-postcard/blob/main/.learn/assets/4geeks.png?raw=true](https://github.com/breatheco-de/exercise-postcard/blob/main/.learn/assets/4geeks.png?raw=true)

## Create by drawing your strategy

![Postcard Strategy](https://github.com/breatheco-de/exercise-postcard/raw/main/.learn/assets/strategy.gif?raw=true)

## You can add different fonts by using free [Google Fonts](https://fonts.google.com/)

1. Click on the font you like.

2. Click get font.

3. Click on Embed code.

4. Add the link tags to your html file.


## What to do if you are stuck?

There is a video about this exercise, watch it if you are lost. But don't copy everything, try to code some of your own.

## Fundamentals
This exercise covers the following fundamentals:
1. Basic structure for every HTML5 website.  
2. The *Link* tag to import CSS3 Rules.  
3. Using google fonts.  
3. Using the different selectors available in CSS3.  
4. Working with containers or boxes: border, padding, and margins.  
5. Overflow.  
6. Using a simple form.  

This and many other exercises are built by students as part of the 4Geeks Academy [Coding Bootcamp](https://4geeksacademy.com/us/coding-bootcamp) by [Alejandro S√°nchez](https://twitter.com/alesanchezr) and many other contributors. Find out more about our [Full Stack Developer Course](https://4geeksacademy.com/us/coding-bootcamps/part-time-full-stack-developer), and  [Data Science Bootcamp](https://4geeksacademy.com/us/coding-bootcamps/datascience-machine-learning).


`

      `const fs = require("fs");
const path = require("path");

test("Make sure you have your index.html", function(){
    const indexExists = fs.existsSync(`./index.html`);
    expect(indexExists).toBe(true);
})

test("Make sure you created the styles.css file", function(){
    const indexExists = fs.existsSync(`./styles.css`);
    expect(indexExists).toBe(true);
})

test("The name of the file is styles.css in plural", function(){
    const indexExists = fs.existsSync(`./style.css`);
    expect(indexExists).not.toBe(true);
})

test("Make sure your styles.css contains the expected style", function(){
    const content = fs.readFileSync("./styles.css", 'utf8')
    const expected = /body\s*{\s*background\s*:\s*black\s*;\s*}/;
    expect(content).toEqual(expect.stringMatching(expected));
})`
      ---
      
      ---This is the current exercise instructions:
      # `08` Adding styles

Si le das clic a `build` ahora, ver√°s que solo dice "Hello". Eso es porque el `<div>` que acabamos de a√±adir no tiene estilos; cambiemos eso.

Para comenzar a darle vida a tu sitio web, debes empezar por a√±adir un archivo `styles.css`. Este contendr√° todo el c√≥digo de estilos de tu sitio web.

## üìù Instrucciones

1. Crea un archivo `styles.css` en la ra√≠z del proyecto y a√±ade el siguiente contenido:

```css
body{
    background: black;
}
```

      `<!-- hide -->
# The Postcard
<!-- endhide -->

Who doesn't like postcards? This is one of your first exercises (if not the first), and it's fun and relatively easy :)

Let's create a postcard with HTML5 and CSS3, and then you can share it with your mom or your other half; they will be proud! :)

## üå±  How to start this project?

1. Make sure you have a Github account at:  https://github.com
2. We recommend opening this repository using a provisioning tool like [Codespaces](https://4geeks.com/lesson/what-is-github-codespaces) (recommended) or [Gitpod](https://4geeks.com/lesson/how-to-use-gitpod). Alternatively, you can clone it on your local computer using the `git clone` command. 

This is the repository you need to open or clone:

```text
https://github.com/breatheco-de/exercise-postcard
```

**üëâ Please follow these steps on** [how to start a coding project](https://4geeks.com/lesson/how-to-start-a-project). IMPORTANT --> this repo isn't a template. 


3. The exercises will start and show the instructions automatically, but if you encounter any issues, you can try running them manually by typing in your command line the following:

```bash
$ learnpack start
```

## Instructions

Create the HTML and CSS3 needed to replicate [this exact same picture](https://raw.githubusercontent.com/breatheco-de/exercise-postcard/main/.learn/assets/preview.png).

![postcard preview](https://raw.githubusercontent.com/breatheco-de/exercise-postcard/main/.learn/assets/preview.png)

> ‚úã Here is the url for the 4Geeks logo: [https://github.com/breatheco-de/exercise-postcard/blob/main/.learn/assets/4geeks.png?raw=true](https://github.com/breatheco-de/exercise-postcard/blob/main/.learn/assets/4geeks.png?raw=true)

## Create by drawing your strategy

![Postcard Strategy](https://github.com/breatheco-de/exercise-postcard/raw/main/.learn/assets/strategy.gif?raw=true)

## You can add different fonts by using free [Google Fonts](https://fonts.google.com/)

1. Click on the font you like.

2. Click get font.

3. Click on Embed code.

4. Add the link tags to your html file.


## What to do if you are stuck?

There is a video about this exercise, watch it if you are lost. But don't copy everything, try to code some of your own.

## Fundamentals
This exercise covers the following fundamentals:
1. Basic structure for every HTML5 website.  
2. The *Link* tag to import CSS3 Rules.  
3. Using google fonts.  
3. Using the different selectors available in CSS3.  
4. Working with containers or boxes: border, padding, and margins.  
5. Overflow.  
6. Using a simple form.  

This and many other exercises are built by students as part of the 4Geeks Academy [Coding Bootcamp](https://4geeksacademy.com/us/coding-bootcamp) by [Alejandro S√°nchez](https://twitter.com/alesanchezr) and many other contributors. Find out more about our [Full Stack Developer Course](https://4geeksacademy.com/us/coding-bootcamps/part-time-full-stack-developer), and  [Data Science Bootcamp](https://4geeksacademy.com/us/coding-bootcamps/datascience-machine-learning).


`

      # File name: README.md. Content: 
      `<!-- hide -->
# The Postcard
<!-- endhide -->

Who doesn't like postcards? This is one of your first exercises (if not the first), and it's fun and relatively easy :)

Let's create a postcard with HTML5 and CSS3, and then you can share it with your mom or your other half; they will be proud! :)

## üå±  How to start this project?

1. Make sure you have a Github account at:  https://github.com
2. We recommend opening this repository using a provisioning tool like [Codespaces](https://4geeks.com/lesson/what-is-github-codespaces) (recommended) or [Gitpod](https://4geeks.com/lesson/how-to-use-gitpod). Alternatively, you can clone it on your local computer using the `git clone` command. 

This is the repository you need to open or clone:

```text
https://github.com/breatheco-de/exercise-postcard
```

**üëâ Please follow these steps on** [how to start a coding project](https://4geeks.com/lesson/how-to-start-a-project). IMPORTANT --> this repo isn't a template. 


3. The exercises will start and show the instructions automatically, but if you encounter any issues, you can try running them manually by typing in your command line the following:

```bash
$ learnpack start
```

## Instructions

Create the HTML and CSS3 needed to replicate [this exact same picture](https://raw.githubusercontent.com/breatheco-de/exercise-postcard/main/.learn/assets/preview.png).

![postcard preview](https://raw.githubusercontent.com/breatheco-de/exercise-postcard/main/.learn/assets/preview.png)

> ‚úã Here is the url for the 4Geeks logo: [https://github.com/breatheco-de/exercise-postcard/blob/main/.learn/assets/4geeks.png?raw=true](https://github.com/breatheco-de/exercise-postcard/blob/main/.learn/assets/4geeks.png?raw=true)

## Create by drawing your strategy

![Postcard Strategy](https://github.com/breatheco-de/exercise-postcard/raw/main/.learn/assets/strategy.gif?raw=true)

## You can add different fonts by using free [Google Fonts](https://fonts.google.com/)

1. Click on the font you like.

2. Click get font.

3. Click on Embed code.

4. Add the link tags to your html file.


## What to do if you are stuck?

There is a video about this exercise, watch it if you are lost. But don't copy everything, try to code some of your own.

## Fundamentals
This exercise covers the following fundamentals:
1. Basic structure for every HTML5 website.  
2. The *Link* tag to import CSS3 Rules.  
3. Using google fonts.  
3. Using the different selectors available in CSS3.  
4. Working with containers or boxes: border, padding, and margins.  
5. Overflow.  
6. Using a simple form.  

This and many other exercises are built by students as part of the 4Geeks Academy [Coding Bootcamp](https://4geeksacademy.com/us/coding-bootcamp) by [Alejandro S√°nchez](https://twitter.com/alesanchezr) and many other contributors. Find out more about our [Full Stack Developer Course](https://4geeksacademy.com/us/coding-bootcamps/part-time-full-stack-developer), and  [Data Science Bootcamp](https://4geeksacademy.com/us/coding-bootcamps/datascience-machine-learning).


`

      `const fs = require("fs");
const path = require("path");
const { fromFile, fromHTML } = require("../../utils/dom");
let dom = fromFile();

test("Make sure you have your index.html", function(){
    const indexExists = fs.existsSync(`./index.html`);
    expect(indexExists).toBe(true);
})

test("Make sure you created the styles.css file", function(){
    const indexExists = fs.existsSync(`./styles.css`);
    expect(indexExists).toBe(true);
})

test("Make sure your index.html contains the <link> tag", function(){
    const content = fs.readFileSync("./index.html", 'utf8')
    document.documentElement.innerHTML = content.toString();
    const linkTag = _document.querySelector("link")
    expect(linkTag).not.toBe(null);
})

test("Create a div with class postcard-header as child of .postcard", function(){
    const e=dom.querySelector('.postcard').inside().querySelector('.postcard-header')
    expect(e).toBeTruthy();
})

test("Create a div with class postcard-body as child of .postcard", function(){
    dom = fromFile();
    const e=dom.querySelector('.postcard').inside().querySelector('.postcard-body')
    expect(e).toBeTruthy();
})

test("Create a div with class postcard-footer as child of .postcard", function(){
    dom = fromFile();
    const e=dom.querySelector('.postcard').inside().querySelector('.postcard-footer')
    expect(e).toBeTruthy();
})
`

    1.2. .postcard-body
    1.3. .postcard-footer

## üîé Importante:

+ No debes incluir el punto (`.`) en el nombre de tu clase, solo usar√°s puntos en CSS.

Content: ` # The Postcard Who doesn't like postcards? This is one of your first exercises (if not the first), and it's fun and relatively easy :) Let's create a postcard with HTML5 and CSS3, and then you can share it with your mom or your other half; they will be proud! :) ## üå± How to start this project? 1. Make sure you have a Github account at: https://github.com 2. We recommend opening this repository using a provisioning tool like [Codespaces](https://4geeks.com/lesson/what-is-github-codespaces) (recommended) or [Gitpod](https://4geeks.com/lesson/how-to-use-gitpod). Alternatively, you can clone it on your local computer using the `git clone` command. This is the repository you need to open or clone: ```text https://github.com/breatheco-de/exercise-postcard ``` **üëâ Please follow these steps on** [how to start a coding project](https://4geeks.com/lesson/how-to-start-a-project). IMPORTANT --> this repo isn't a template. 3. The exercises will start and show the instructions automatically, but if you encounter any issues, you can try running them manually by typing in your command line the following: ```bash $ learnpack start ``` ## Instructions Create the HTML and CSS3 needed to replicate [this exact same picture](https://raw.githubusercontent.com/breatheco-de/exercise-postcard/main/.learn/assets/preview.png). ![postcard preview](https://raw.githubusercontent.com/breatheco-de/exercise-postcard/main/.learn/assets/preview.png) > ‚úã Here is the url for the 4Geeks logo: [https://github.com/breatheco-de/exercise-postcard/blob/main/.learn/assets/4geeks.png?raw=true](https://github.com/breatheco-de/exercise-postcard/blob/main/.learn/assets/4geeks.png?raw=true) ## Create by drawing your strategy ![Postcard Strategy](https://github.com/breatheco-de/exercise-postcard/raw/main/.learn/assets/strategy.gif?raw=true) ## You can add different fonts by using free [Google Fonts](https://fonts.google.com/) 1. Click on the font you like. 2. Click get font. 3. Click on Embed code. 4. Add the link tags to your html file. ## What to do if you are stuck? There is a video about this exercise, watch it if you are lost. But don't copy everything, try to code some of your own. ## Fundamentals This exercise covers the following fundamentals: 1. Basic structure for every HTML5 website. 2. The *Link* tag to import CSS3 Rules. 3. Using google fonts. 3. Using the different selectors available in CSS3. 4. Working with containers or boxes: border, padding, and margins. 5. Overflow. 6. Using a simple form. This and many other exercises are built by students as part of the 4Geeks Academy [Coding Bootcamp](https://4geeksacademy.com/us/coding-bootcamp) by [Alejandro S√°nchez](https://twitter.com/alesanchezr) and many other contributors. Find out more about our [Full Stack Developer Course](https://4geeksacademy.com/us/coding-bootcamps/part-time-full-stack-developer), and [Data Science Bootcamp](https://4geeksacademy.com/us/coding-bootcamps/datascience-machine-learning). ` --- --- # File name: index.html. Content: ` # The Postcard Who doesn't like postcards? This is one of your first exercises (if not the first), and it's fun and relatively easy :) Let's create a postcard with HTML5 and CSS3, and then you can share it with your mom or your other half; they will be proud! :) ## üå± How to start this project? 1. Make sure you have a Github account at: https://github.com 2. We recommend opening this repository using a provisioning tool like [Codespaces](https://4geeks.com/lesson/what-is-github-codespaces) (recommended) or [Gitpod](https://4geeks.com/lesson/how-to-use-gitpod). Alternatively, you can clone it on your local computer using the `git clone` command. This is the repository you need to open or clone: ```text https://github.com/breatheco-de/exercise-postcard ``` **üëâ Please follow these steps on** [how to start a coding project](https://4geeks.com/lesson/how-to-start-a-project). IMPORTANT --> this repo isn't a template. 3. The exercises will start and show the instructions automatically, but if you encounter any issues, you can try running them manually by typing in your command line the following: ```bash $ learnpack start ``` ## Instructions Create the HTML and CSS3 needed to replicate [this exact same picture](https://raw.githubusercontent.com/breatheco-de/exercise-postcard/main/.learn/assets/preview.png). ![postcard preview](https://raw.githubusercontent.com/breatheco-de/exercise-postcard/main/.learn/assets/preview.png) > ‚úã Here is the url for the 4Geeks logo: [https://github.com/breatheco-de/exercise-postcard/blob/main/.learn/assets/4geeks.png?raw=true](https://github.com/breatheco-de/exercise-postcard/blob/main/.learn/assets/4geeks.png?raw=true) ## Create by drawing your strategy ![Postcard Strategy](https://github.com/breatheco-de/exercise-postcard/raw/main/.learn/assets/strategy.gif?raw=true) ## You can add different fonts by using free [Google Fonts](https://fonts.google.com/) 1. Click on the font you like. 2. Click get font. 3. Click on Embed code. 4. Add the link tags to your html file. ## What to do if you are stuck? There is a video about this exercise, watch it if you are lost. But don't copy everything, try to code some of your own. ## Fundamentals This exercise covers the following fundamentals: 1. Basic structure for every HTML5 website. 2. The *Link* tag to import CSS3 Rules. 3. Using google fonts. 3. Using the different selectors available in CSS3. 4. Working with containers or boxes: border, padding, and margins. 5. Overflow. 6. Using a simple form. This and many other exercises are built by students as part of the 4Geeks Academy [Coding Bootcamp](https://4geeksacademy.com/us/coding-bootcamp) by [Alejandro S√°nchez](https://twitter.com/alesanchezr) and many other contributors. Find out more about our [Full Stack Developer Course](https://4geeksacademy.com/us/coding-bootcamps/part-time-full-stack-developer), and [Data Science Bootcamp](https://4geeksacademy.com/us/coding-bootcamps/datascience-machine-learning). ` --- --- # File name: index.html. Content: ` # The Postcard Who doesn't like postcards? This is one of your first exercises (if not the first), and it's fun and relatively easy :) Let's create a postcard with HTML5 and CSS3, and then you can share it with your mom or your other half; they will be proud! :) ## üå± How to start this project? 1. Make sure you have a Github account at: https://github.com 2. We recommend opening this repository using a provisioning tool like [Codespaces](https://4geeks.com/lesson/what-is-github-codespaces) (recommended) or [Gitpod](https://4geeks.com/lesson/how-to-use-gitpod). Alternatively, you can clone it on your local computer using the `git clone` command. This is the repository you need to open or clone: ```text https://github.com/breatheco-de/exercise-postcard ``` **üëâ Please follow these steps on** [how to start a coding project](https://4geeks.com/lesson/how-to-start-a-project). IMPORTANT --> this repo isn't a template. 3. The exercises will start and show the instructions automatically, but if you encounter any issues, you can try running them manually by typing in your command line the following: ```bash $ learnpack start ``` ## Instructions Create the HTML and CSS3 needed to replicate [this exact same picture](https://raw.githubusercontent.com/breatheco-de/exercise-postcard/main/.learn/assets/preview.png). ![postcard preview](https://raw.githubusercontent.com/breatheco-de/exercise-postcard/main/.learn/assets/preview.png) > ‚úã Here is the url for the 4Geeks logo: [https://github.com/breatheco-de/exercise-postcard/blob/main/.learn/assets/4geeks.png?raw=true](https://github.com/breatheco-de/exercise-postcard/blob/main/.learn/assets/4geeks.png?raw=true) ## Create by drawing your strategy ![Postcard Strategy](https://github.com/breatheco-de/exercise-postcard/raw/main/.learn/assets/strategy.gif?raw=true) ## You can add different fonts by using free [Google Fonts](https://fonts.google.com/) 1. Click on the font you like. 2. Click get font. 3. Click on Embed code. 4. Add the link tags to your html file. ## What to do if you are stuck? There is a video about this exercise, watch it if you are lost. But don't copy everything, try to code some of your own. ## Fundamentals This exercise covers the following fundamentals: 1. Basic structure for every HTML5 website. 2. The *Link* tag to import CSS3 Rules. 3. Using google fonts. 3. Using the different selectors available in CSS3. 4. Working with containers or boxes: border, padding, and margins. 5. Overflow. 6. Using a simple form. This and many other exercises are built by students as part of the 4Geeks Academy [Coding Bootcamp](https://4geeksacademy.com/us/coding-bootcamp) by [Alejandro S√°nchez](https://twitter.com/alesanchezr) and many other contributors. Find out more about our [Full Stack Developer Course](https://4geeksacademy.com/us/coding-bootcamps/part-time-full-stack-developer), and [Data Science Bootcamp](https://4geeksacademy.com/us/coding-bootcamps/datascience-machine-learning). ` --- --- # File name: index.html.       # File name: README.md. Content: 
      `<!-- hide -->
# The Postcard
<!-- endhide -->

Who doesn't like postcards? This is one of your first exercises (if not the first), and it's fun and relatively easy :)

Let's create a postcard with HTML5 and CSS3, and then you can share it with your mom or your other half; they will be proud! :)

## üå±  How to start this project?

1. Make sure you have a Github account at:  https://github.com
2. We recommend opening this repository using a provisioning tool like [Codespaces](https://4geeks.com/lesson/what-is-github-codespaces) (recommended) or [Gitpod](https://4geeks.com/lesson/how-to-use-gitpod). Alternatively, you can clone it on your local computer using the `git clone` command. 

This is the repository you need to open or clone:

```text
https://github.com/breatheco-de/exercise-postcard
```

**üëâ Please follow these steps on** [how to start a coding project](https://4geeks.com/lesson/how-to-start-a-project). IMPORTANT --> this repo isn't a template. 


3. The exercises will start and show the instructions automatically, but if you encounter any issues, you can try running them manually by typing in your command line the following:

```bash
$ learnpack start
```

## Instructions

Create the HTML and CSS3 needed to replicate [this exact same picture](https://raw.githubusercontent.com/breatheco-de/exercise-postcard/main/.learn/assets/preview.png).

![postcard preview](https://raw.githubusercontent.com/breatheco-de/exercise-postcard/main/.learn/assets/preview.png)

> ‚úã Here is the url for the 4Geeks logo: [https://github.com/breatheco-de/exercise-postcard/blob/main/.learn/assets/4geeks.png?raw=true](https://github.com/breatheco-de/exercise-postcard/blob/main/.learn/assets/4geeks.png?raw=true)

## Create by drawing your strategy

![Postcard Strategy](https://github.com/breatheco-de/exercise-postcard/raw/main/.learn/assets/strategy.gif?raw=true)

## You can add different fonts by using free [Google Fonts](https://fonts.google.com/)

1. Click on the font you like.

2. Click get font.

3. Click on Embed code.

4. Add the link tags to your html file.


## What to do if you are stuck?

There is a video about this exercise, watch it if you are lost. But don't copy everything, try to code some of your own.

## Fundamentals
This exercise covers the following fundamentals:
1. Basic structure for every HTML5 website.  
2. The *Link* tag to import CSS3 Rules.  
3. Using google fonts.  
3. Using the different selectors available in CSS3.  
4. Working with containers or boxes: border, padding, and margins.  
5. Overflow.  
6. Using a simple form.  

This and many other exercises are built by students as part of the 4Geeks Academy [Coding Bootcamp](https://4geeksacademy.com/us/coding-bootcamp) by [Alejandro S√°nchez](https://twitter.com/alesanchezr) and many other contributors. Find out more about our [Full Stack Developer Course](https://4geeksacademy.com/us/coding-bootcamps/part-time-full-stack-developer), and  [Data Science Bootcamp](https://4geeksacademy.com/us/coding-bootcamps/datascience-machine-learning).


`

const path = require("path");
const { fromFile, fromHTML } = require("../../utils/dom");
let dom = fromFile();

test("Make sure you have your index.html", function(){
    const indexExists = fs.existsSync(`./index.html`);
    expect(indexExists).toBe(true);
})

test("Make sure you created the styles.css file", function(){
    const indexExists = fs.existsSync(`./styles.css`);
    expect(indexExists).toBe(true);
})

test("Make sure your index.html contains the <link> tag", function(){
    const content = fs.readFileSync("./index.html", 'utf8')
    document.documentElement.innerHTML = content.toString();
    const linkTag = _document.querySelector("link")
    expect(linkTag).not.toBe(null);
})

test("Create a div with class postcard-header as child of .postcard", function(){
    const e=dom.querySelector('.postcard').inside().querySelector('.postcard-header')
    expect(e).toBeTruthy();
})

test("Create a div with class postcard-body as child of .postcard", function(){
    dom = fromFile();
    const e=dom.querySelector('.postcard').inside().querySelector('.postcard-body')
    expect(e).toBeTruthy();
})

test("Create a div with class postcard-footer as child of .postcard", function(){
    dom = fromFile();
    const e=dom.querySelector('.postcard').inside().querySelector('.postcard-footer')
    expect(e).toBeTruthy();
})

      # File name: README.md. Content: 
      `<!-- hide -->
# The Postcard
<!-- endhide -->

Who doesn't like postcards? This is one of your first exercises (if not the first), and it's fun and relatively easy :)

Let's create a postcard with HTML5 and CSS3, and then you can share it with your mom or your other half; they will be proud! :)

## üå±  How to start this project?

1. Make sure you have a Github account at:  https://github.com
2. We recommend opening this repository using a provisioning tool like [Codespaces](https://4geeks.com/lesson/what-is-github-codespaces) (recommended) or [Gitpod](https://4geeks.com/lesson/how-to-use-gitpod). Alternatively, you can clone it on your local computer using the `git clone` command. 

This is the repository you need to open or clone:

```text
https://github.com/breatheco-de/exercise-postcard
```

**üëâ Please follow these steps on** [how to start a coding project](https://4geeks.com/lesson/how-to-start-a-project). IMPORTANT --> this repo isn't a template. 


3. The exercises will start and show the instructions automatically, but if you encounter any issues, you can try running them manually by typing in your command line the following:

```bash
$ learnpack start
```

## Instructions

Create the HTML and CSS3 needed to replicate [this exact same picture](https://raw.githubusercontent.com/breatheco-de/exercise-postcard/main/.learn/assets/preview.png).

![postcard preview](https://raw.githubusercontent.com/breatheco-de/exercise-postcard/main/.learn/assets/preview.png)

> ‚úã Here is the url for the 4Geeks logo: [https://github.com/breatheco-de/exercise-postcard/blob/main/.learn/assets/4geeks.png?raw=true](https://github.com/breatheco-de/exercise-postcard/blob/main/.learn/assets/4geeks.png?raw=true)

## Create by drawing your strategy

![Postcard Strategy](https://github.com/breatheco-de/exercise-postcard/raw/main/.learn/assets/strategy.gif?raw=true)

## You can add different fonts by using free [Google Fonts](https://fonts.google.com/)

1. Click on the font you like.

2. Click get font.

3. Click on Embed code.

4. Add the link tags to your html file.


## What to do if you are stuck?

There is a video about this exercise, watch it if you are lost. But don't copy everything, try to code some of your own.

## Fundamentals
This exercise covers the following fundamentals:
1. Basic structure for every HTML5 website.  
2. The *Link* tag to import CSS3 Rules.  
3. Using google fonts.  
3. Using the different selectors available in CSS3.  
4. Working with containers or boxes: border, padding, and margins.  
5. Overflow.  
6. Using a simple form.  

This and many other exercises are built by students as part of the 4Geeks Academy [Coding Bootcamp](https://4geeksacademy.com/us/coding-bootcamp) by [Alejandro S√°nchez](https://twitter.com/alesanchezr) and many other contributors. Find out more about our [Full Stack Developer Course](https://4geeksacademy.com/us/coding-bootcamps/part-time-full-stack-developer), and  [Data Science Bootcamp](https://4geeksacademy.com/us/coding-bootcamps/datascience-machine-learning).


`

      # File name: test.js. Content: 
      `const fs = require("fs");
const path = require("path");
const { fromFile, fromHTML } = require("../../utils/dom");
let dom = fromFile();

test("Make sure you have your index.html", function(){
    const indexExists = fs.existsSync(`./index.html`);
    expect(indexExists).toBe(true);
})

test("Make sure you created the styles.css file", function(){
    const indexExists = fs.existsSync(`./styles.css`);
    expect(indexExists).toBe(true);
})

test("Make sure your index.html contains the <link> tag", function(){
    const content = fs.readFileSync("./index.html", 'utf8')
    document.documentElement.innerHTML = content.toString();
    const linkTag = _document.querySelector("link")
    expect(linkTag).not.toBe(null);
})

test("Create a div with class postcard-header as child of .postcard", function(){
    const e=dom.querySelector('.postcard').inside().querySelector('.postcard-header')
    expect(e).toBeTruthy();
})

test("Create a div with class postcard-body as child of .postcard", function(){
    dom = fromFile();
    const e=dom.querySelector('.postcard').inside().querySelector('.postcard-body')
    expect(e).toBeTruthy();
})

test("Create a div with class postcard-footer as child of .postcard", function(){
    dom = fromFile();
    const e=dom.querySelector('.postcard').inside().querySelector('.postcard-footer')
    expect(e).toBeTruthy();
})
`

      # File name: README.md. Content: 
      `<!-- hide -->
# The Postcard
<!-- endhide -->

Who doesn't like postcards? This is one of your first exercises (if not the first), and it's fun and relatively easy :)

Let's create a postcard with HTML5 and CSS3, and then you can share it with your mom or your other half; they will be proud! :)

## üå±  How to start this project?

1. Make sure you have a Github account at:  https://github.com
2. We recommend opening this repository using a provisioning tool like [Codespaces](https://4geeks.com/lesson/what-is-github-codespaces) (recommended) or [Gitpod](https://4geeks.com/lesson/how-to-use-gitpod). Alternatively, you can clone it on your local computer using the `git clone` command. 

This is the repository you need to open or clone:

```text
https://github.com/breatheco-de/exercise-postcard
```

**üëâ Please follow these steps on** [how to start a coding project](https://4geeks.com/lesson/how-to-start-a-project). IMPORTANT --> this repo isn't a template. 


3. The exercises will start and show the instructions automatically, but if you encounter any issues, you can try running them manually by typing in your command line the following:

```bash
$ learnpack start
```

## Instructions

Create the HTML and CSS3 needed to replicate [this exact same picture](https://raw.githubusercontent.com/breatheco-de/exercise-postcard/main/.learn/assets/preview.png).

![postcard preview](https://raw.githubusercontent.com/breatheco-de/exercise-postcard/main/.learn/assets/preview.png)

> ‚úã Here is the url for the 4Geeks logo: [https://github.com/breatheco-de/exercise-postcard/blob/main/.learn/assets/4geeks.png?raw=true](https://github.com/breatheco-de/exercise-postcard/blob/main/.learn/assets/4geeks.png?raw=true)

## Create by drawing your strategy

![Postcard Strategy](https://github.com/breatheco-de/exercise-postcard/raw/main/.learn/assets/strategy.gif?raw=true)

## You can add different fonts by using free [Google Fonts](https://fonts.google.com/)

1. Click on the font you like.

2. Click get font.

3. Click on Embed code.

4. Add the link tags to your html file.


## What to do if you are stuck?

There is a video about this exercise, watch it if you are lost. But don't copy everything, try to code some of your own.

## Fundamentals
This exercise covers the following fundamentals:
1. Basic structure for every HTML5 website.  
2. The *Link* tag to import CSS3 Rules.  
3. Using google fonts.  
3. Using the different selectors available in CSS3.  
4. Working with containers or boxes: border, padding, and margins.  
5. Overflow.  
6. Using a simple form.  

This and many other exercises are built by students as part of the 4Geeks Academy [Coding Bootcamp](https://4geeksacademy.com/us/coding-bootcamp) by [Alejandro S√°nchez](https://twitter.com/alesanchezr) and many other contributors. Find out more about our [Full Stack Developer Course](https://4geeksacademy.com/us/coding-bootcamps/part-time-full-stack-developer), and  [Data Science Bootcamp](https://4geeksacademy.com/us/coding-bootcamps/datascience-machine-learning).


`

    expect(linkTag).not.toBe(null);
})

test("Create a div with class postcard-header as child of .postcard", function(){
    const e=dom.querySelector('.postcard').inside().querySelector('.postcard-header')
    expect(e).toBeTruthy();
})

test("Create a div with class postcard-body as child of .postcard", function(){
    dom = fromFile();
    const e=dom.querySelector('.postcard').inside().querySelector('.postcard-body')
    expect(e).toBeTruthy();
})

test("Create a div with class postcard-footer as child of .postcard", function(){
    dom = fromFile();
    const e=dom.querySelector('.postcard').inside().querySelector('.postcard-footer')
    expect(e).toBeTruthy();
})

This is one of your first exercises (if not the first), and it's fun and relatively easy :) Let's create a postcard with HTML5 and CSS3, and then you can share it with your mom or your other half; they will be proud! :) ## üå± How to start this project? 1. Alternatively, you can clone it on your local computer using the `git clone` command. This is the repository you need to open or clone: ```text https://github.com/breatheco-de/exercise-postcard ``` **üëâ Please follow these steps on** [how to start a coding project](https://4geeks.com/lesson/how-to-start-a-project). IMPORTANT --> this repo isn't a template. 3. The exercises will start and show the instructions automatically, but if you encounter any issues, you can try running them manually by typing in your command line the following: ```bash $ learnpack start ``` ## Instructions Create the HTML and CSS3 needed to replicate [this exact same picture](https://raw.githubusercontent.com/breatheco-de/exercise-postcard/main/.learn/assets/preview.png). ![postcard preview](https://raw.githubusercontent.com/breatheco-de/exercise-postcard/main/.learn/assets/preview.png) > ‚úã Here is the url for the 4Geeks logo: [https://github.com/breatheco-de/exercise-postcard/blob/main/.learn/assets/4geeks.png?raw=true](https://github.com/breatheco-de/exercise-postcard/blob/main/.learn/assets/4geeks.png?raw=true) ## Create by drawing your strategy ![Postcard Strategy](https://github.com/breatheco-de/exercise-postcard/raw/main/.learn/assets/strategy.gif?raw=true) ## You can add different fonts by using free [Google Fonts](https://fonts.google.com/) 1. Click on the font you like. 2. Click get font. 3. Click on Embed code. 4. Add the link tags to your html file. ## What to do if you are stuck? There is a video about this exercise, watch it if you are lost. But don't copy everything, try to code some of your own. ## Fundamentals This exercise covers the following fundamentals: 1. Basic structure for every HTML5 website. 2. The *Link* tag to import CSS3 Rules. 3. Using google fonts. 3. Using the different selectors available in CSS3. 4. Working with containers or boxes: border, padding, and margins. 5. Overflow. 6. Using a simple form. This and many other exercises are built by students as part of the 4Geeks Academy [Coding Bootcamp](https://4geeksacademy.com/us/coding-bootcamp) by [Alejandro S√°nchez](https://twitter.com/alesanchezr) and many other contributors. Agrega dos nuevos `` dentro del div `.postcard-body`. Ambos deben ser parientes (estar en el mismo nivel), pero tener el mismo padre (el div `postcard-body` es el padre). > Nota: El primer `
` debe tener la clase `body-left` y el que est√° justo debajo debe tener la clase `body-right`. ```txt 1 .postcard 1.1 .postcard-header 1.1.1 h1 1.1.2 img 1.2 .postcard-body 1.2.1 .body-left 1.2.2 .body-right 1.3 .postcard-footer ``` 2. --soy el lado derecho--

Content: ` # The Postcard Who doesn't like postcards? This is one of your first exercises (if not the first), and it's fun and relatively easy :) Let's create a postcard with HTML5 and CSS3, and then you can share it with your mom or your other half; they will be proud! :) ## üå± How to start this project? 1. Make sure you have a Github account at: https://github.com 2. We recommend opening this repository using a provisioning tool like [Codespaces](https://4geeks.com/lesson/what-is-github-codespaces) (recommended) or [Gitpod](https://4geeks.com/lesson/how-to-use-gitpod). Alternatively, you can clone it on your local computer using the `git clone` command. This is the repository you need to open or clone: ```text https://github.com/breatheco-de/exercise-postcard ``` **üëâ Please follow these steps on** [how to start a coding project](https://4geeks.com/lesson/how-to-start-a-project). IMPORTANT --> this repo isn't a template. 3. The exercises will start and show the instructions automatically, but if you encounter any issues, you can try running them manually by typing in your command line the following: ```bash $ learnpack start ``` ## Instructions Create the HTML and CSS3 needed to replicate [this exact same picture](https://raw.githubusercontent.com/breatheco-de/exercise-postcard/main/.learn/assets/preview.png). ![postcard preview](https://raw.githubusercontent.com/breatheco-de/exercise-postcard/main/.learn/assets/preview.png) > ‚úã Here is the url for the 4Geeks logo: [https://github.com/breatheco-de/exercise-postcard/blob/main/.learn/assets/4geeks.png?raw=true](https://github.com/breatheco-de/exercise-postcard/blob/main/.learn/assets/4geeks.png?raw=true) ## Create by drawing your strategy ![Postcard Strategy](https://github.com/breatheco-de/exercise-postcard/raw/main/.learn/assets/strategy.gif?raw=true) ## You can add different fonts by using free [Google Fonts](https://fonts.google.com/) 1. Click on the font you like. 2. Click get font. 3. Click on Embed code. 4. Add the link tags to your html file. ## What to do if you are stuck? There is a video about this exercise, watch it if you are lost. But don't copy everything, try to code some of your own. ## Fundamentals This exercise covers the following fundamentals: 1. Basic structure for every HTML5 website. 2. The *Link* tag to import CSS3 Rules. 3. Using google fonts. 3. Using the different selectors available in CSS3. 4. Working with containers or boxes: border, padding, and margins. 5. Overflow. 6. Using a simple form. This and many other exercises are built by students as part of the 4Geeks Academy [Coding Bootcamp](https://4geeksacademy.com/us/coding-bootcamp) by [Alejandro S√°nchez](https://twitter.com/alesanchezr) and many other contributors. Find out more about our [Full Stack Developer Course](https://4geeksacademy.com/us/coding-bootcamps/part-time-full-stack-developer), and [Data Science Bootcamp](https://4geeksacademy.com/us/coding-bootcamps/datascience-machine-learning). ` --- ---This is the current exercise instructions: # `13` Check Your Postcard La √∫ltima parte ser√° el pie del postcard. ¬øCu√°l es el √∫nico elemento presente all√≠? ![Postcard body content](../../assets/13.gif) ## üìù Instrucciones: 1. ` hacia el centro (el bot√≥n estar√° centrado). ```css .postcard-footer { text-align: x; } ``` 3. Aplica un `background` m√°s oscuro y un `padding` al bot√≥n. ```css button { background-color: x; padding: x; } ``` ---

Gracias por compartir tu c√≥digo HTML. Ahora, vamos a asegurarnos de que el CSS est√© correctamente aplicado para centrar el bot√≥n y darle el estilo adecuado.

1. **Aseg√∫rate de que el CSS para `.postcard-footer` est√© configurado correctamente:**

   ```css
   .postcard-footer {
       text-align: center;
   }
   ```

2. **Aplica el estilo al bot√≥n:**

   ```css
   button {
       background-color: #333; /* Puedes cambiar este color a uno que prefieras */
       padding: 10px 20px; /* Ajusta el padding seg√∫n tus necesidades */
       color: white; /* Esto es opcional, pero ayuda a que el texto sea visible */
       border: none; /* Esto es opcional, para quitar el borde del bot√≥n */
       border-radius: 5px; /* Esto es opcional, para redondear las esquinas del bot√≥n */
   }
   ```

3. **Verifica que el CSS est√© correctamente vinculado en tu archivo HTML:**

   Aseg√∫rate de que tu archivo HTML tenga un enlace a tu archivo CSS en la secci√≥n `<head>`:

   ```html
   <head>
       <link rel="stylesheet" href="styles.css"> <!-- Aseg√∫rate de que la ruta sea correcta -->
   </head>
   ```

Algunas preguntas para reflexionar:

1. ¬øEl archivo CSS est√° correctamente vinculado en tu HTML?
2. ¬øHas aplicado las reglas CSS mencionadas anteriormente?
3. ¬øQu√© sucede cuando inspeccionas el elemento en el navegador? ¬øEl bot√≥n aparece pero no est√° centrado, o no aparece en absoluto?

Revisa estos puntos y ajusta tu c√≥digo seg√∫n sea necesario. ¬øPuedes compartir m√°s detalles sobre c√≥mo se ve el bot√≥n actualmente y qu√© esperas que suceda?
